page.title: 04Salhouse
page.content: Salhouse village has two distinct parts, one near the{railway station} and{Dakenham Hall}and the main part to the south of{Salhouse Broad.}The village is quiet and attractive and set amongst gently rolling farmland. {Lower Street}runs through the village and along it are situated the{Post {Office,}a{butcher's shop, The Bell {Inn,}a{riding school}and the original{ {school}now replaced by a modern building nearby. Salhouse has a close-knit community where everybody seems on first name terms.In summer holidaymakers from cruisers on{Salhouse Broad}mingle with local people.In the village is the house of the{Norfolk Reed Thatcher,}a traditional Norfolk craftsman and there are examples of his work throughout the village.
